elements: An occasionally coherent catalogue of the secret gods, organised by hour. This is a reprint, but in the original Latin.
An occasionally coherent catalogue of the secret gods, organised by hour. This is an English translation.
The annotated dream-journals of Christopher Illopoly.
Warnings and confessions about the cost of the secret arts, addressed to a student by the seventeenth-century magus (and reputed immortal) Julian Coseley.
The Locksmith's Dream: a Light through the Keyhole
The first volume of Teresa Galmier's examination of parallels in the mystic dreams of artisans.
The Locksmith's Dream: Portions and Proportions
The second volume of Teresa Galmier's examination of parallels in the mystic dreams of artisans.
The third volume of Teresa Galmier's examination of parallels in the mystic dreams of artisans.
An original edition of a compilation of quasi-Rosicrucian allegories, supposedly by Robert Fludd. This is in the original Latin.
Part of a compilation of quasi-Rosicrucian allegories, supposedly by Robert Fludd. This is a later English translation.
Just what you need to refresh your knowledge of Latin.
There's always more to know. [Use with three Erudition to gain Reason.]
The opposite of wisdom, thankfully. [Use with three Glimmerings to gain Passion.]
